Is there any windows API (application program interface) to execute thread on atomic mode?

comments.text: Obviously Not. That's what preemptive multitasking (in contrast to cooperative multitasking) means. Preemption means the operating system may preempt your thread at any moment (for any reason or for no reason at all as far as you're concerned), and it actually does.

answers_data.content: The Interlocked API may be what you are looking for. Or more generally, here is the MSDN topic on synchronization.
